intro: Mascagnia almedae, commonly known as the Almeda's mescal bean, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by follicles containing elongated, curved seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
